AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: ATLAS chat appears to follow a generic triage/template flow (license-key gating and button prompts) and does not provide any issue-specific troubleshooting for the deployment timeout problem before routing to L1.
evidence: “Please select from the below or give me a detailed description of what’s happening. Any error messages you’ve seen or steps you’ve already tried would be really helpful.”
“While not mandatory, it may be useful for troubleshooting if you provide me with the GFI LanGuard license key for which you are contacting us.”
“Please select the option that applies below 👇”
“Kayako - ticket id 60252140 // ATLAS commented privately: Action: l1”

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: The customer is not trapped in an AI-only loop; multiple human agents respond and the customer is able to request actions (logs review, remote session) directly with humans.
evidence: “Kayako - ticket id 60252140 // Randall Shawver commented publicly: Dear Jonard,”
“Kayako - ticket id 60252140 // Keyur Saxena commented publicly: Hello Jonard,”
“Kayako - ticket id 60252140 // Andriy Rybalchenko commented publicly: Dear Jonard,”

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support repeats/duplicates instructions and continues requesting additional/fresh logs despite the customer stating they already uploaded logs and provided prior data; there is also an outright duplicate public reply posted twice, indicating poor context handling.
evidence: Duplicate reply posted twice by the same agent: “Kayako - ticket id 60252140 // Randall Shawver commented publicly: Dear Jonard, ...” (appears twice at 2025-11-28T19:18:37 and 2025-11-28T19:19:08)
Customer already provided logs: “Hi, I’ve already uploaded the logs to the FTP folder. Kindly check them.”
Customer indicates repeated logging requests: “HI, i already send a lot of logs here in the case ticket that's why the client want also to have a remote session if it's possible”
Support still asks for another fresh set: “Even though logs were shared before, we do need a scan results + fresh set after the previous log files were deleted to eliminate noise”

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: There are multiple multi-day gaps where the customer follows up due to lack of response (e.g., logs uploaded on Dec 3, then follow-ups on Dec 5 and Dec 10 before a substantive response; another gap after Dec 11 log submission until Dec 15).
evidence: Customer uploads logs: “Hi, I’ve already uploaded the logs to the FTP folder. Kindly check them.” (2025-12-03)
Customer follow-up: “Hi is there any updates for this?” (2025-12-05)
Customer follow-up again: “Hello, good day i just want to follow up this ticket” (2025-12-10)
Customer provides/mentions PatchAgent log then waits: “Hi Keyur, kindly check the patch agent log” (2025-12-11)
Customer follow-up: “Hi, any update on this.” (2025-12-15)
Support acknowledges delay: “Apologies for the delayed response here.” (2025-12-10)

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: The ticket shows auto-closure warnings (“stay open for one week…”) but there is no evidence the ticket was actually closed while the customer awaited an answer within the provided timeline.
evidence: “This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed in the portal.”

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: The issue is impactful (timeouts/auto-remediation problems), but the customer never labels it as critical/outage/urgent/SEV1 and there is no explicit statement of production-down or broad business outage requiring P1 handling.
evidence: “GFI LanGuard deployment timeout for large package”
“Just to add, the auto-remediation is not working as well.”
